sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The Popes bull: or, papal creed. Made at Trent, and promulgated at Rome by Pope-Pious, Fourth. Demonstrated to be antichristian VVhereunto is added, a discourse between an English Protestant, and a popish Jesuit: who endeavoured to seduce some persons in London, to the imbracing of popery: necessary to be seen by all that would know the present faith of Rome, especially in these our nations, where they conceal it. Catholic Church. Pope (1559-1565 : Pius IV)
12 p.
printed for Fran. Smith, at the Elephant and Castle, neer the Royal Exchange in Cornhill, and at the same sign, at the first shop without Temple-Bar, London : 1673.
"Nineteen quæries tending to unbeguile a Protestant from that deceipt of Scriptures, being the guide of faith" has caption title on p. 5. Reproduction of the original in the Exeter College Library, Oxford.
=======

Catholic Church. Pope (1559-1565 : Pius IV)
12 p.
printed for Fran. Smith, at the Elephant and Castle, neer the Royal Exchange in Cornhill, and at the same sign, at the first shop without Temple-Bar, London : 1673.
"Nineteen quæries tending to unbeguile a Protestant from that deceipt of Scriptures, being the guide of faith" has caption title on p. 5. Reproduction of the original in the Exeter College Library, Oxford.

the Elephant
the Royal Exchange in Cornhill
